definitions.definition: A piece of cloth covering a window, bed, etc. to offer privacy and keep out light.
A similar piece of cloth that separates the audience and the stage in a theater.
(by extension) The beginning of a show; the moment the curtain rises.
definitions.example: He took so long to shave his head that we arrived 45 minutes after curtain and were denied late entry.

definitions.definition: (fortifications) The flat area of wall which connects two bastions or towers; the main area of a fortified wall.
That part of a wall of a building which is between two pavilions, towers, etc.
To cover (a window) with a curtain; to hang curtains.
To hide, cover or separate as if by a curtain.
(in reference to curtains closing at the end of a stage show) An end, death
definitions.example: "What if a bunch of scuba divers nosed about here?" / "Curtains for them, when our side-scan sonar sees them."

definitions.definition: A ring of clear liquid, forming into drops, near the top of a glass of fortified wine; the result of differential evaporation of alcohol and subsequent changes in surface tension; an example of the Marangoni effect
